abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement action plan aims to
            compensate all project affected households and organizations
            (PAPs) and aid them in maintaining their standard of living
            or bettering it. Compensation will be at substitution rates
            or market prices. Compensation for houses, buildings, and
            trees must be at replacement cost regardless of
            depreciation. All PAPs are entitled to compensation and
            rehabilitation whether or not they hold legal entitlements
            to the land. No households will have to resettle because
            removed houses will be reconstructed on land near the
            original site. Households with houses demolished in part
            will be compensated in cash at the substitution rate. The
            total amount of compensation issued to the household has to
            equal the cost of materials and labor needed to reconstruct
            the demolished section of the house. If demolition of the
            damaged section damages the remaining sections of the house,
            compensation will be added to pay the cost of repairs. PAPs
            losing agricultural lands will be compensated in cash or opt
            for land for land compensation. Compensation for crops will
            be given in cash at current market rates calculated on the
            productive average of the last three years. Compensation for
            trees will be provided in cash at substitution rates. In
            addition to direct compensation for losses, PAPs will
            receive other subsidies.
